page.title: 07Buying a house in 1985
page.content: Buying a house in 1985 can be quite a task. My enquiries in Gillingham showed I could buy a house for Â£23,995 I wrote to a Building Society and an Estate Agent. I was told I would need a loan which I would pay back over 25 or 30 years. My house is quite a large house because seven people live in it. We have got double glazing and we have an extention. We have five bedrooms, two bathrooms, two toilets, with a kitchen, lounge, diningroom, stairs and a passage which the cats sleep in and a freezer room. In our kitchen we have all the modern gadgets like a dishwasher, washing machine, microwave oven, oven, fridge freezer, electric sandwich toaster, toaster, electric kettle, sodastream, an electric potato peeler and a mixer. In the dining room we have a colour TV, two computers and a record player.
